cluster_relations.rel_desc: Twig mimicry helps caterpillars avoid being seen by predators.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in visual environment where predators search
qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when predators rely on sight to locate prey

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Leaf mimicry conceals caterpillars from their predators.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Butterfly Ecology, Habitat, and Food Web

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when predators visually search for caterpillars
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Effect: decreases likelihood of being eaten

args.canonical_rel_desc: The camouflage adaptation conceals the organism from specified predators, reducing the likelihood of being detected and eaten.
args.justification: Both relations describe specific camouflage adaptations (twig mimicry, leaf mimicry) functionally hiding caterpillars from their predators to reduce predation risk; a unified predicate expressing concealment from predators fits both.

These relations link particular camouflage adaptations to their predator targets as part of an anti-predator defense mechanism; grouping them under a camouflage-focused defense relation class captures this shared functional role.
The relations encode a causal defensive effect: camouflage causes reduced visual detection and thus lower predation risk from the specified predators, matching a causal/defensive semantic dimension.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: The camouflage adaptation conceals the organism from specified predators, reducing the likelihood of being detected and eaten.
